resp:

1. First, we look at the table to determine if any nation has won 2 silver medals or 2 bronze medals, as those are the only types of medals won by Canada, the United States, and Russia according to the table.

2. We see that Canada has won 2 silver medals, so it satisfies the claim for one type of medal (silver). The United States and Russia have not won any silver medals, but we need to check if they have won 2 bronze medals each.

3. We observe that neither the United States nor Russia has won 2 bronze medals, so they do not satisfy the claim for bronze medals.

4. Since Canada has fulfilled one part of the claim and the other two nations did not fulfill any part of the claim, it is false that all three nations each win 2 medals.
